author: wired blogs
text: date: thu, 18 nov 1999 17:04:58 -0700 from: markham breitbach (markham_breitbach@ssimicro.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: real networks class actionwith regard to "grokking the privacy lesson," 16.nov.1999,as much as i fully support the class action suit (and other charges) i fearit is doomed to fail.it is a little bit ambiguous, as is most legalese,but any of the users who installed real networks' player agreed to let thesoftware have any and all access for whatever purposes. i think the license agreement (the one that you have to agree to whenyou install the software!) makes it pretty clear that the software may ormay not do anything in particular, and that realnetworks is not responsiblefor anything that the software may or may not do.i think the real issue at stake here is the ability of the softwaredevelopers (i.e. realnetworks) to force the user into such a contract.
